Package Controllers

Class TransactionController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.TransactionController
public class TransactionController extends Object
Provides static methods to manage transactions for the currently logged-in user in the Finance Tracker System. This controller supports adding, viewing, editing, and deleting transactions, and ensures that account balances and budget progress are updated accordingly.

Responsibilities

  • Add new transactions for the current user, updating account balances and budget progress.
  • Display all transactions belonging to the current user.
  • Edit transaction details, including title, date, and description.
  • Delete transactions by ID, updating account balances and budget progress.

Usage Example

 TransactionController.addTransaction("Salary", 5000.0, "Savings", "Income", LocalDate.now(), "Monthly salary");
 TransactionController.viewTransactions();
 TransactionController.editTransaction(transactionId, "Updated Title", LocalDate.now(), "Updated description");
 TransactionController.deleteTransaction(transactionId);

Dependencies

  • Transaction - The transaction model being managed.
  • Account - Used for updating account balances.
  • CategoryType - Enum for transaction type (INCOME, EXPENSE).
  • UserController - For accessing currentUser and saving user details.
  • CategoryController - For category lookup and type determination.
  • AccountController - For account lookup by name.
  • BudgetController - For updating budget progress after transaction changes.

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. All operations assume single-threaded access to currentUser. If used in a multi-threaded environment, external synchronization is required.

Validation

This class performs basic validation (e.g., existence of user, account, category, and transaction). Further validation (such as input format or duplicate transactions) should be handled externally.

Extensibility

Additional transaction operations (such as tags, receipt images, or audit logging) can be added as needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionController

      public TransactionController()

  • Method Details

    • addTransaction

      public static boolean addTransaction(String title, double amount, String accountName, String categoryName, LocalDate date, String description)
      Adds a new transaction for the current user, updates the relevant account balance, and recalculates budget progress.

      The transaction is created and added to the user's transaction list. The account balance is updated based on the transaction type (income increases, expense decreases). Budget progress is recalculated to reflect the new transaction.

      Parameters:
      title - Title of the transaction.
      amount - Amount of the transaction.
      accountName - Name of the account associated with the transaction.
      categoryName - Name of the category associated with the transaction.
      date - Date of the transaction.
      description - Description of the transaction.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction is added and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • viewTransactions

      public static void viewTransactions()
      Displays all transactions belonging to the current user. Prints "No transactions found." if there are no transactions. Each transaction is displayed using its Transaction.toString() representation.

    • editTransaction

      public static boolean editTransaction(UUID transactionId, String title, LocalDate date, String description)
      Edits the title, date, and description of an existing transaction. If the transaction is found, updates its fields and persists user details.
      Parameters:
      transactionId - UUID of the transaction to edit.
      title - New title for the transaction.
      date - New date for the transaction.
      description - New description for the transaction.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction is updated and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • deleteTransaction

      public static boolean deleteTransaction(UUID transactionId)
      Deletes a transaction with the specified ID from the current user's transaction list, and updates the relevant account balance accordingly.

      If the transaction is found and deleted, the account balance is reverted based on the transaction type. For expenses, the amount is added back; for income, the amount is subtracted.

      Parameters:
      transactionId - UUID of the transaction to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the transaction is deleted and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.
